titleStmt.title: By the Lords-Justices of Ireland. Charles Porter, Tho. Coningesby, Information haveing been given us, that divers soldiers of the regiment of the Lord George Hamilton, out of a dislike to their Majesties service, have deserted and left their colours, ...
titleStmt.author: Ireland. Lords Justices and Council.
Coningsby, Thomas Coningsby, Earl, 1656?-1729.

titleStmt.title: By the Lords-Justices of Ireland. Charles Porter, Tho. Coningesby, Information haveing been given us, that divers soldiers of the regiment of the Lord George Hamilton, out of a dislike to their Majesties service, have deserted and left their colours, ...
titleStmt.author: Ireland. Lords Justices and Council.
Coningsby, Thomas Coningsby, Earl, 1656?-1729.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Andrew Crook assignee of Benjamin Tooke, printer to the King and Queen at thier Majesties printing-house on Ormonde-Key,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption and opening words of text.
"Given at their Majesties castle of Dublin, this 4th day of January. 1691.".
Date given according to Lady Day dating.
Pardon to deserters from Lord George Hamilton's regiment.--Steele.
Steele notation: Arms 199. divers day they.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
